DOC.brief_summary: This study look dietary pattern individual chronic spinal cord injury relationship dietary pattern cardiovascular disease risk factor . The study supplement Coronary Artery Risk Development Young Adults ( CARDIA ) study . The dietary history CARDIA use . The investigator ' primary hypothesis following : Greater whole-grain dietary fiber intake favorably associate adiposity ( BMI WC ) metabolic CVD risk factor ( fast glucose , fast insulin , HOMA-IR , diabetes , hsCRP , TC , HDL-C , triglyceride , TC/HDL-C ratio , non-HDL-C , systolic diastolic blood-pressure ) among sample individual SCI age 38-50 injured > 1 year .
DOC.brief_title: Dietary Patterns Cardiovascular ( CVD ) Risk Spinal Cord Injury ( SCI ) Factors In Individuals With Chronic Spinal Cord Injury
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Male female , black white SCI due nonvascular insult cause acute spinal cord injury ( i.e . traumatic injury , transverse myelitis without diagnosis multiple sclerosis , surgical complication , benign neoplasm ) least 1 year prior enrollment include ASIA A , B , C Age time enrollment : > 38 year < 55 year ( i.e. , 38th birthday 55th birthday ) Voluntary , inform consent participant Participant willing comply test protocol questionnaire Communication comprehension sufficient compliance test procedure measure Exclusion Criteria SCI vascular malignant etiology Pregnancy , endstage renal disease , treatment cancer except nonmelanoma skin cancer past five year Injury < 1 year prior enrollment ASIA D Chronic , nontobacco substanceabuse
